intro: Hoffmannia mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican Hoffmania, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Cactaceae, which includes cacti and other succulent plants. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its water-storing tissues. Hoffmannia mexicana is often found in rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal in dry gardens.
